sen.j: 智洞（ちどう、元文元年（1736年）- 文化 (元号)2年10月22日 (旧暦)（1805年12月12日））は、江戸時代中期から後期にかけての浄土真宗の僧。
sen.e: Chido (1736-December 12, 1805) was a priest of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) from the mid to the late Edo period.

sen.j: 功存の三業帰命説を継承し広めたが、その他の学僧と対立し、三業惑乱の騒動を引き起こした。
sen.e: He carried on and spread Sango-kimyo-setsu (the theory that faith is essential for three activities (action, speech and thought)) of Kozon, but he confronted other Gakuso (scholar monk) and he caused the Sango Wakuran Controversy (The Incident that Disturbed the Three Deeds).

sen.j: 幕府の裁定により智洞の三業帰命説は異義と断定され、遠流の刑に処せられたが、処分される前に江戸の獄中で亡くなった。
sen.e: A decision of Bakufu determined Sango-kimyo-setsu of Chido was wrong and he was sentenced to Onru (to be exiled to the farthest distant island), but he died in prisonin Edo before enforcement.

A ruling by the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) concluded that Chido's Sango-kimyo-setsu was wrong and he was sentenced to Onru (exile to the farthest island), but died during imprisonment in Edo before it could be enforced.
